content: बंधकः {@--1@} One who binds or catches, a binder. {@--2@} A catcher. {@--3@} A band, tie, rope, tether. {@--4@} A dike, bank, dam. {@--5@} A pledge, deposit. {@--6@} A posture of the body. {@--7@} Barter, exchange. {@--8@} A violator, ravisher. {@--9@} A promise. {@--10@} A city. {@--11@} A part or portion (at the end of num. compounds); ऋणं सदशबंधकं <ls>Y. 2. 76.</ls> --कं Binding, confinement. --की {@--1@} An unchaste woman; न मे त्वया कौमारबंधक्या प्रयोजनं <ls>Māl. 7</ls>; <ls>Ve. 2.</ls> {@--2@} A harlot, courtezan; बलात् धृतोसि मयेति बंधकीधाष्टर्यं <ls>K. 237.</ls> {@--3@} A female elephant. {@--4@} A barren woman.
